title: Autonomous Strategy Development Iteration State
description: Persistent state for autonomous QuantConnect strategy development workflow

current_hypothesis.name: Statistical Arbitrage Pairs Trading
current_hypothesis.description: Market-neutral pairs trading across 4 diverse pairs using Z-score based entry/exit with dollar-neutral positioning
current_hypothesis.rationale: Based on CLAUDE0 backtest showing strong performance (Sharpe 4.454, 77% win rate, 7.13% max DD, 14.73% CAGR). Strategy trades mean reversion in cointegrated pairs across different sectors: Regional bank vs Banking ETF, BDC vs MLP ETF, International banks, Energy infrastructure vs Utility. Multiple exit mechanisms (mean reversion, timeout, stop-loss) provide risk management.

main.py.description: QC entry point - MUST exist for backtesting. This file is executed by QuantConnect.

research.ipynb.description: Monte Carlo validation notebook - Generated by /qc-validate, run in QC Research

optional_files.*.py: Additional strategy files that main.py can import

backtest_results.reason: Strong baseline performance (Sharpe 1.809, Drawdown 8.3%, 799 trades). Exceeds production-ready thresholds - skipping optimization and proceeding directly to validation.

optimization.limitation: Skipped - baseline performance exceeds production-ready thresholds

decisions_log.reason: Existing strategy code identified with strong historical performance metrics (Sharpe 4.454, 77% win rate). Strategy implements market-neutral pairs trading with proper risk management.
Strong baseline performance (Sharpe 1.809, Drawdown 8.3%, 799 trades). Exceeds production-ready thresholds - skipping optimization and proceeding directly to validation.

next_steps: Run /qc-validate to perform Monte Carlo validation
Generate validation notebook for out-of-sample testing
Verify strategy robustness with walk-forward analysis
